title: Triple baby killer who suffocated his own children moved to open prison
text:

A man who suffocated his three children has been moved to an open prison.

Simon Smith was jailed in 1996 for killing three-month-old Lauren, six-month-old Jamie and Eleisha, aged 10 months.

The murders took place between 1989 and 1994 in the Staffordshire town of Stone, Birmingham Live reported.

At first Eleisha and Jamie, who were born during his first marriage, were thought to have died of cot death.

Suspicions were aroused however when Lauren died of asphyxiation a year after Jamie's death.

(Image: THE SENTINEL)

Lauren's Mother, Rachel Playfair, has described her former partner as "pure evil" while speaking against the decision - which could see him allowed back into the public.

“My biggest fear is that he will be released from prison and find another woman," the mum told the BBC.

"He is pure evil. He only killed his own flesh and blood. The judge repeatedly said life means life."

Ms Playfair expressed concerns that 50-year-old Smith could find another woman and father another child if he is released from prison.

She also questioned why he was now deemed not a risk to the public, two years after the parole board decided to keep him inside a secure facility.

During the murder trial, Smith tried to convince jurors that while he killed Lauren, the other babies died of cot death.

(Image: THE SENTINEL)

The jury heard Smith took baby Lauren into a pub in Stone where he had two-and-a-half pints of beer on the first day he had looked after her on his own.

Then, because Lauren was crying, Smith took her to Westbridge Park where he pushed her face into a car seat before taking her home and suffocating her with his hand over her face.

The trainee care home assistant was convicted on three counts of murder after expert witnesses suggested the children had all been suffocated.

Ms Playfair believes her daughter Lauren was born to bring about justice for Jamie and Eleisha - her death triggering an investigation into the other two babies'.

Earlier this year the bereaved mum started a petition calling for Smith to be kept in a secure prison.

(Image: THE SENTINEL)

It received more than 4,500 signatures.

The Ministry of Justice said public protection was its priority and offenders were returned to closed prison "at the first sign of concern".

A Ministry of Justice spokeswoman said: "This will understandably be a very distressing decision for the victims' families and our thoughts remain with them.

"The independent Parole Board conducts a thorough risk assessment before recommending a transfer to open conditions."
description: The Parole Board has moved murderer Simon Smith to an open prison after he killed three babies in the Staffordshire town of Stone
